The hotel was well situated for our visit to see an off-Broadway play and visit family. Staff was friendly and helpful; the rooms are well-designed and very clean. Many restaurants and shops are a convenient walking distance.

Had room facing street and you hear all the construction and transit noise. Couldn't sleep. Hotel is average and certainly not worth the $509/night I paid. They couldn't give me another room citing hotel was full.

We spent one night in NYC for my son's birthday here. I only wish we could've spent more nights. This hotel is beautiful and modern with a sharp lobby, wonderful bell staff, and front desk personnel couldn't have been more pleasant. The room was just the right size for what we needed. The bed/shower/hot beverage center were all impeccable. Our only issue was that the housekeeping staff repeatedly knocked on our door beginning at 8:00 am the next morning: every hour on the hour. We tried to sleep in, but the noise in the hallway was terribly loud. We neglected to put the "do not disturb" sign on the door, and regretted it. Don't forget to put the sign on your door before you go down for the night! You'll be glad you did! Other than the early morning disturbances, this was a very lovely hotel.

The staff is outstanding in their service. Very professional and welcoming. This goes a long way when you are in the hassle and bustle of NYC and when you are traveling away from home. The food at the restaurant is excellent and the service at the bar and restaurant is impressive. The rooms are a bit small and the hotel can be a bit noisy at times since its right above the police station but the location is good because its close to all the Jazz clubs and great restaurants.
user_name:
Iphigenia Leoni... K
Philadelphia, United States

review_body: nice hotel, convenient location. very cooperative and helpful staff. Good experience. Room was clean. Breakfast was well prepared. Hotel price is high, but I guess that's NYC. I would definitely come back another time.

We stayed a week. Great location on lower east side of Manhattan. The staff was very helpful and prompt to help, e.g. bring more hangers. The faucet was so close to the sink bottom that I could not put my hands together beneath it to wash them; so the staff moved us to a room with a higher faucet but of course that took time to pack some. Room was small but adequate. The air condition and/or heater had some odor that gave my wife a headache, she has allergies. The floor was not cleaned daily. The room was quiet but load neighbors could clearly be heard late into the evening. The head of the front desk did give us extra points for our troubles.

My cousin and I visited my daughter and we needed a room with 2 beds. This turns out to be a difficult thing to find in NYC. The Hyatt Union Square was in the right area for and had a few rooms with 2 beds. Had no idea what a great location it was. Turns out Union Square is a big transfer station for many of the subway lines. Our room was attractive, well-lit, clean- and we appreciated the two small closets. They were on one side of each bed, so we had our own closet with hanging space and nice big drawers. The staff couldn't have been more welcoming and solicitous. Eating and drinking options on site- the cafe was perfect for breakfast on get-away day. So many coffee shops, bakeries and restaurants within a block or two. We walked almost everywhere. So happy to have a place to stay whenever I visit my daughter. No more online searching.

I am glad I booked the Hyatt union square. The price for the room was very reasonable and the stay was completely worth each penny spent.The hotel has a very small reception but are very helpful and rather quick. On requesting late checkout they gladly obliged and adjusted my room accordingly. I'm sure if they have availability they would do so.The rooms are the regular size you would expect in a good New York hotel and have all amenities needed available along with a good selection in the mini-bar.The hotel is walking distance from a number of great restaurants and coffee shops around the corner. There is a medical store opposite the hotel which is convenient in case of an emergency.The Hyatt union square is the perfect choice if you are visiting New York city for business or holidays.

The staff was amazing. The location is great. The beds are comfortable. We had a lovely stay in NYC.The room service was yummy. Everything was clean and cool at the hotel but not overly hip.I would highly recommend this hotel.

This was our second stay at Hyatt Union Square to visit our son and for some medical appts The Urbane sky room was very comfortable , quiet and clean . Staff was really accomodating and friendly especially Hanna at the frint desk . Great location We will be staying there on our next trip to NY .

Very nice hotel, centraly located amidst many restaurants, stores and parks. The hotel has a young and enthusiastic staff who genuinely want to make this your best holiday ever. Breakfast in their restaurant is an enjoyable experience, dinner was very nice too, try the mozzarella dish !

I did a great deal of research before deciding on a hotel to stay at in Manhattan. I landed on the Hyatt at Union Square because of its relative affordability and its ideal location. Most of the hotels in Manhattan carry a high price tag, but where the Hyatt excels is its ability to provide a comfortable and hassle free stay for less than the price of other surrounding hotels.We arrived in NYC early morning and to our surprise, the hotel was able to check us in at 9am, which greatly improved our weekend vacation. Upon arrival, check in was easy and the front desk made sure to provide anything that we requested. Union Square proved to be a great place to stay in because of it's central location in Manhattan, which made it easy to get to any corner of the city, whether by walking, subway, or taxi (or in our case, Uber). The room was small but made up for its size with the amenities it provided and the large bathroom and shower.The service at the hotel was 5-star, except for one small hiccup I had concerning the complimentary shoe shine service, wherein employee never showed up to polish my shoes at my request. Other than that, our entire stay was smooth, comfortable and genuinely pleasant.If you would like to stay in Manhattan for a decent price while not having to compromise on creature comforts, the Hyatt at Union Square will meet your needs and leave you satisfied.

Excellent service and overall great hotel. Everything within walking distance. Very helpful and friendly staff. Great room for the price. Definitely a higher end hotel. Rooms are nicely decorated and beds super comfortable. Highly recommend staying here.

I've been staying at the Hyatt Union Square at least 2-3 times per month since January for work trips. I started staying there because it was the closest to my office, but after trying out other nearby hotels, I find myself returning time after time to the Hyatt. My favorite things: good balance in the lobby (easy to hang out and wait if needed, but not overdone or too large to navigate), fast elevators, super comfy beds, AMAZING blackout curtains (I've overslept more times than I can count - I now rely on the wake up calls!), a decent selection of snacks in the room, good room service (the homemade donuts are the best), good restaurant/bar right in the hotel, and very helpful staff. All of these make for a generally great experience every time I have stayed here. Just a few things could use improvement: I was initially booking through a 3rd party website and so even though I was staying at least a few times per month, the front desk staff wouldn't recognize me and would give me the entire new guest spiel each time. At one point I think I even said, "Seriously? I was here last week." to the person at the check in counter who asked if I had stayed with them before. She had checked me in at least 2-3 times prior. If I'm staying this often at your hotel, I'd like to think you'd treat me like I'm coming home to somewhere familiar, even if booking through a 3rd party. Perhaps it's a technique to convince frequent guests to use their proprietary rewards system? Also, many rooms (mostly the courtyard-facing ones) don't have a minibar fridge, which is frustrating when you'd like a cold drink without ordering room service or heading outside. Finally, every single time I stay, I request foam pillows instead of the feather ones. You'd think that the front desk would note this and have them automatically placed in my room upon my arrival. Just a few improvements would make this hotel spectacular, and I would be extremely hard to convince to stay anywhere else in the City!

I had a great stay at this hotel. The staff and general manager were phenomenal-both personable and attentive. The Hyatt team goes above and beyond. My room was also wonderful- modern, spacious, and very clean. I would absolutely stay here again and would highly recommend it to others.

If I can single out your greatest asset, it is going to be the extraordinary group of staff that you have assembled. Always ready to help, quite hospitable and always wearing a smile. the moment we arrived we were welcomed by a couple of sweet smiling front desk staff and checking in was swift, even offered us water ( hot day) to quench our thirst . Clean, comfortable and nice smelling room.
user_name:
Alex P
scotch plains, United States

review_body: The hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful with the exception of Alejandro whom we found difficult to deal with. Orherwise, a great location and a nice hotel for the value!! Rooms are very small.

We received excellent, friendly service in this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The only problem was the noise from the city streets. Perhaps a room on a higher floor would have been quieter.

Loved the rooms. great decor and layout. Not to funky but enough to make it feel very relevant. Big shower with great pressure. The floors were wood ( or wood like). Restaurant was just ok, small portions ( not small plates) but reasonably priced.

Stayed here for a total of 8 nights recently. First three nights were for business, the next five were for 'pleasure'. The business portion of the stay was great. I was given a room without a refrigerator and was provided one quickly when I requested one. I needed additional hangers and those too were provided without issue. Hyatt provides in room coffee and I was provided two packages of regular coffee each day. All was good. Then came the personal part of my stay. One night I was awoken in the wee hours of the morning by what sounded like a dog scratching on the door and a VERY STRONG smell of lacquer. When leaving my room the next day, I could tell that the baseboards in the hallway had been worked on and also had appeared to have been painted. In the middle of the night, really? On the second day of my personal stay, we were provided no regular coffee, when we called to inquire we were told that they had run out but that coffee would be provided in the lobby the next morning from 5 am to 7 or 8 am I believe. When we went to the lobby for coffee, we were told that wasn't offered on the weekends. We then had no option but to buy from their restaurant or go to a local coffee shop. Before heading back to our room that evening we checked on the coffee. We were told they only had decaf. For the remainder of our stay the regular coffee was not replenished. How does an organization as large as Hyatt run out of regular coffee? Another day we returned to our room in the early evening after a day of sightseeing to find our room had not been made up. Another day we were provided no hand towels. On our final day we attempted to use the computer in their lobby to print our boarding passes only to find out the computer had a software issue and we couldn't access the airline's site. I can't complain about the front desk staff as they were all friendly, helpful, professional and courteous. But I'm perplexed as to what happened halfway through our stay. The first three days were great, the next five, not so.

My fiancé and I stayed here during 9-11 weekend. The hotel was very nice. The hotel was trendy and had a great vibe. The decor was beautiful. The room was clean. The bed was super comfortable and the shower head was large, rainfall type. The location was a block from Union Square and convenient for transit. The area was vibrant and there were several restaurants and shops within walking distance.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt in Union Square. We were very happy with the staff at the hotel. Everyone including Sambali and Victor were very helpful and attentive as well as super friendly. We would definitely recommend this hotel and look to stay there for our next visit to NYC.

This was our 5th time staying at Hyatt Union Square, the staff and we love staying here every time. The location of this hotel is second to none. It is a beautifully decorated hotel with decent size rooms.

This past weekend was my first time staying at the Hyatt Union Square, and I would definitely go back. In addition to the super-convenient location near transportations, shopping and great restaurants what really stood out was the staff. It felt great to be greeted by name when I left or retuned to the hotel. Francois at the front desk really stood out in this regard. When it came time to check out, Hannah and her front desk team took care of all my needs including arranging transportation and holding a package that a friend was coming by later to pick up. Super impressed!

I have been to this hotel many times over the years and find that it is consistently well run. I like that it is a small boutique type hotel and it is very comfortable to come back to after a great day in the city.
user_name:
Michelle K
Grand Rapids, United States

review_body: Alarm in room (518) was defective. It went off without reason. Took too long to get fix. The room on Saturday was not cleaned. Had to to clean while we were having dinner. Over charged for valet parking when it was clearly indicted valet parking was for 1 night since the rental was returned on Friday.

When there for a business trip and spend 3 nights. Walking distance around Union Square. Very nice service from all places, good dinning tips, Restaurant, even shoes pollishing included and deliver every day.Great rooms and fair price. Might go back in november with a 14 persons Group for 3-5 nights each! Hope to get a good deal ! Haha

Summary of Issues: 1. Toiletries were never replaced despite being completely empty.2. Inconsistent service with several employees seeming completely confused by hotel systems3. Hotel did not honor Diamond upgrade privileges 4. Disappointing and over priced restaurant Pros:1. Close proximity to union square2. New property Detailed Review: As a diamond member and frequent traveler I was excited to try this property. I typically stay at the Park Hyatt (which is amazing) or one of the many great boutique hotels in NYC. However, I was met with disappointment after disappointment. When I checked in I was notified that there was an upgrade available but that they may have to move me later during my stay. I graciously accepted the upgrade and was promptly relocated the next day. However, when checking online the room type I was upgraded to still available. When I asked about why I was moved when the room type was still available I was met with a blank stare followed by "You are right, I don't know why the moved you. But they moved you already so I can't do anything now." The Diamond benefits letter was delivered the following day since nothing was explained at check in. The Diamond breakfast benefit is a $25 credit at the restaurant in the lobby. The service in the restaurant is good, but the food is just alright and over priced (i.e. a side of mixed berries is $14). The rooms are well appointed but have awkward built ins on the walls that take up quite a bit of space while providing no tangible benefit.

This was a first-class hotel near our son's apt. in East Village.We loved the bar, the room, and the location! We were there on the 15th anniversary of 9/11 and the Fire Station across the street was having a memorial celebration for 12 of their firefighters who lost their lives on that day. It was very inspiring!

We were there seeing our son. The hotel is in a perfect location for a good price. Comfortable beds, smallish rooms with good amenities. Located near Union Square. Convenient to great restaurants and shopping.

We have stayed at this hotel several times now and are always happy with it. We originally booked this location due to its convenient location to our daughter's dorm. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The room is comfortable and the shower is wonderful! Convenient to subway and the neighborhood is great!

Nice small loft style room- clean and very well designed. Good sound proofing- despite being on the street side -little noise. Perfect for one person on a business trip. Also great location for NYU visits..
user_name:
Clare Mc T
Boston, United States

review_body: I don't know what happened, but it's not the same (nice) hotel anymore...changed menu (no goose liver need staff, no bathroom supplies replenishment, dubious age of towels...WHAT HAPPENED! We stay at this hotel at least once every two months as it is close to our son's apartment, but the vibe is now totally different (new ownership? New management?) and it looks like they are on a saving binge... At the client's expense,,, the restaurant service still good, but the place is deserted, even for what used to be jazz Sunday brunch (hint: there is no live jazz anymore...)

This is an unbelievable hotel. The rooms are boutique-sized New York hotel rooms. But, they are beautifully appointed with all of the amenities you can imagine. The floors, showers and furniture are pristine and appear to be brand new. Would definitely stay again.

Did not get my folio emailed to me as I had requested and confirmed with the front desk m. Late-arriving breakfast (ordered between 8:15-8:30, showed up at 8:40). As a gold passport platinum member I expected a lot more.

This hotel is a true gem and the staff make every stay personalized and special. i was shocked when after staying only a handful of times, they recognized me as a repeat customer. Truly outstanding service!

Very convenient location next to Union Square. I took overnight flight from west coast and arrived at hotel around 10 amin the morning and was very tired. But, the staff at front desk was able to find a room for me to check in immediately, which was the best experience of this trip. During my last a couple of trips to NYC I had to wait till afternoon before getting a room at other hotels. However, the room is very small at Hyatt. The fitness facility was excellent. I

With the exception of our iPad stolen from our room and management runaround which was unfortunate, the hotel, location, room and staff were all very nice and comfortable. You could not ask for a better location right next to of Union Square. Rooms were very comfortable and quiet for NYC.

First time in New York, took a long Labor Day weekend trip! The rooms were clean and modern, loved the design. The staff were very accommodating, whatever we needed, they handled quickly. The city is a very noisy place but the double panes windows did what they could to quiet things down. One small downside is I would like to have had access to an ice machine on our floor but the staff will get it for you, just seems more convenient to have a quick pop down the hall to get some ice.

More of a boutique hotel look and feel. The rooms are updated and modern and well designed for such small spaces. The restaurant was nice and the staff was helpful. The location was right next to union square which is a great part of town.
user_name:
cliffjust
Bryce Canyon National Park, Utah

review_body: The perfect place to stay when we were dropping off our daughter at NYU. Just a block from Union Square, friendly and helpful staff, and worth upgrading to a room with a small patio. Definitely will stay here again.

Customer service is everything to me. People who go the extra mile rock! Thanks Jorge! You delivered.Thanks for making my birthday special. You're kindness was greatly appreciated. Hoping to be back soon.
user_name:
salmonf2016
New York City, New York

review_body: This is my husband and I's 2nd stay at Hyatt Union Square. The staff is so welcoming and helpful. You can tell them are happy to work there. The room was so clean and amazing! They even upgraded us to a larger room and in NYC every sq ft counts. We will be back!

Conveniently located, boutique feel and quiet! Unobtrusive, yet warm and friendly staff. Subway station with key connections and stops just a block away. Great restaurants next door and around. Downside, and very frustrating is the very poor bathroom lighting! Make-up mirrors are offered but come in they are small. Wish they would just improve the lighting!

We like to stay in different places when we visit NYC. We are glad we stayed here this time. The hotel is in an excellent location, one block from Union Square and walking distance to the the Village and other great locations for dining, bars, and entertainment. The rooms are very nice, although NYC size, and comfortable. Staff was pleasant and helpful. We would stay here again.

Very nice Hyatt property seems more like a boutique hotel than a corporate one. Rooms are a bit small, per Manhattan standards, but everything is well-done and attended to. Restaurant and bar were both excellent as well. I'll be waiting to return to this property.

This was my first stay at this hotel. We were bringing my daughter to school and this was the closest hotel to her dorm. Only a block and a half. Great hotel, clean, beautiful and excellent service. My daughter goes to NYU so this is a great location for me and I will definitely be staying here again soon! Close to some very nice vegetarian and vegan restaurants (which we are) as well as breakfast/coffee shops.

We had a great experience at the Hyatt Union Square. It is a lovely hotel - elegant, lobby and rooms in perfect condition and well maintained, staff extremely pleasant and helpful, and fantastic location. Absolutely no complaints! Will come again!

I came into town for business without any expectations. I assumed the rooms would be small because it's New York City! I was first greeted and taken care of quickly and professionally by the friendliest staff on the planet, then I was shocked when I walked into my room and found basically an oasis. It's got this interesting Japanese/Island retreat/modern themes vibe to it and it somehow came through as both elegant and funky at the same time. The bed was comfortable, the shower was AMAZING and I thoroughly enjoyed the stay there. I ordered room service and I can definitely recommend the spaghetti. It's overpriced for sure but that's a New York Hotel for you! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area.
user_name:
Kisha R W
Cambridge, United States

review_body: I really can't be bothered to spend too much time writing a full fledged review so I shall do this in point form:1. This property considers their corner room a suite - I think they call it the Alcove loft, which is a huge joke, so when you use your diamond suite upgrades this is what you are going to be getting. I cannot imagine what a basic room is going to be like.2. They don't have a proper breakfast buffet, which poses a problem especially if you are a diamond member. Although they did attempt to fix the problem by crediting me fully, I still think that they should fix their breakfast offerings instead. Have a different menu for diamond members. They were offering a $25 per person credit which is a joke if you look at their prices. When I have breakfast included, I expect a buffet, if you do not have a buffet like at some Park Hyatt properties then I expect to be able to order whatever I like on the ala carte menu. I am not an unreasonable person, for 2 people this is what we ordered to share: minute steak with eggs, french toast, juice and one other item most likely. So we basically had a bit of meat, eggs, carbs/pastry with the french toast... and juice which is what you would typically get in a buffet. And this with tip comes up to a whopping 80-100 bucks. I had breakfast there, 2 or 3 times and that was what the bill was, the hotel wanted to cover something like $60-$70 bucks I was adamant that my order would constitute what a normal breakfast would be. And that should not be $80-$100. I just hate having to haggle. 3. If you have matte tile floors in the toilet that needs special care and be wet mopped, that did not happen during my stay. Bear in mind that whenever I ask for my room to be cleaned I tip the usual $5. So I expect my room to be cleaned properly.Overall the experience was ok, it was not horrible but it was surely average. The room was tiny even after the upgrade. If I was going to be paying $300-$400 for the room I would surely be staying some where else. Also this hotel has little to no facilities. I must say the servers at their breakfast place was above average.

Its overall youthful energy of the hotel and the neighborhood were a big attraction. It was sylish and shared a contemporary aesthetic. The Fourth, its restaurant offers nice brunch. Friendly service, great location, reasonable price

The hotel is in a perfect part of NYC. The staff could not be friendlier or more accommodating! The hotel is immaculate! The management recognized a special occasion which even made our stay more special!
user_name:
janbW4023KP
New York City, New York

review_body: I waited too long to stay here! My over night in a Loft room was a pleasant one. Beautiful , clean rooms. The service was very good. The front desk very informative of neighborhood. They booked up too fast for my next stay...
user_name:
vicherbster
New York City, New York

review_body: as a frequent traveller at the Hyatt I expected an upgrade or at least a bigger room. Also at the morning all the food rest and plates in de corridor were not nice to see.But the staf was really GREAT expecially the concierges. Many thanks guys.

This is not your typical Hyatt property. From the moment you touch the hotel door handles, you realize you're in for a unique Hyatt experience. This place just feels very warm and organic.Great location, close to Union Square Park. Great friendly accommodating staff.The room, what can I say? Again, very organic feel. Studio style layout, with wood floors. Very nicely appointed. Everything was just perfect.

I really like the location of this hotel. It's conveniently located near NYU, which I often visit. I find the service and staff to be very good. I would say the only "mild complaint" is the tight spaces and very small closet/clothing storage. The rooms with two beds have more closet space. Other than that, I recommend staying here and will be returning myself.

Wonderful time we had at the apartment. Very helpful staff including the maids. The place was cleaned every day, and all items in the flat was in good working order.Highly customer friendly reception and door man

My trip was to settle my freshman into college with a mountain of luggage, deliveries from stores and eventually ending in a solo stay. From the moment I entered , staff acknowledged me and quickly got us situated. Ensuing requirements for storage , receiving deliveries and organizing transport were dealt with in an efficient and friendly manner . Nothing seemed too much trouble. Wait staff in restaurant made my solo dinner friendly and relaxed. Will definitely come back. Thanks for everything.

From the moment my car pulled up to the hotel (and throughout my entire stay) (two weeks) I felt as though there was no one more important than me. I had many needs and never once heard a sarcastic tone from anyone. My housekeeper, Kelly, treated me as though I was family. The front desk and restaurant (Great food! French toast - omg!) were always pleasant and helpful and genuinely seemed to enjoy interacting with everyone. Very professional. My room was promptly cleaned daily and always had plenty of linens/towels/pillows - whatever I needed was delivered with a smile. As far as sleep goes... I may come back just for a good night's sleep! I chose this hotel because it is in close proximity to my daughter's new apartment. I love NYC. I come here many times a year and enjoy luxury hotels in various neighborhoods. Hyatt Union Square (Urbane Terrace) is definitely my "go to" hotel room going forward.

We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The facility is wonderfully appointed. The bar/restaurant was lovely, the rooms were comfortable and clean, and the staff was attentive. The location of this property was convenient to everything we wanted to get to - NYU, restaurants, shopping,etc. I would recommend it.

the elevator was out for at least a week and the room I was in did not have good air-conditioning and the air conditioner was very noisy. It rattled constantly making sleeping very difficult. Staff was nice enough, but didn't seem to be able to get the facility fixed in a reasonable time frame.

Great central location, attentive staff, great value. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future for both business and pleasure. Last year, we used homeaway and realized we are hotel people, and this checked off all the boxes.

Stylish hotel. Great decor. Stylish, clean guest rooms. Be prepared that the bath, except commode, is open to the sleeping area (not private). This hotel is a tranquil oasis in the bustling Union Square area. Superb location. Restaurant was not inspiring. But many fun restaurants to explore close by.
user_name:
Nancy W
Coeur d Alene, United States

review_body: Stayed four nights in August. The first night we did not use the room as we arrived in NY at 7am. The next two days at 4pm on the second day, I had to request that there had been no room service and the place was still unmade. This was rectified when we left to go out for dinner.The third day, the story was the same, we requested that the room be cleaned and made up at 6pm just as we were leaving for dinner.There was two tea bags in the room of different types, after using the plain tea bag on the second day, it was not replaced and the one type I do not use stayed the only tea bag available.I did mention these concerns on checking out and was told that they were sorry that this had occured.It seemed as though the house staff had little training or management as to how, who and when they were expected to do their jobs.

I am not sure exactly why I find this hotel so delightful but I've stayed here several times and it never disappoints. The rooms are small, but well-appointed and cozy, comfortable, modern yet warm. Love the beds and the showers. The bar downstairs is perfectly intimate and not too slick. The overall scale of the hotel is perfect, in my opinion. And the location is fantastic, if you are familiar with NY. It might take some getting used to, if you're a tourist as you are not in the thick of things. But you can walk to the best parts of NY from here.On my last visit there, I noticed some furniture in the room was a bit worn, but that didn't bother me. The hotel is spotless, which is critical. Love it for business and pleasure.

Excellent location for TNS parents.Check in process very efficient. The flavored water in the lobby was delicious. The room is very efficient. I like the design. I also like the neighborhood. The doormen were very polite.

Always enjoy our stay here near Union Square. Friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable and very up to date rooms. We feel this hotel provides us very good value compared to other hotels under $500.00 per night.

We have been staying at the Hyatt Union Square for years and we love it. Great location. I love the attention of the front desk people. This the best place to stay in the area. We our daughter to tour NYU and we stayed there last week and it was perfect. Close to Washington Square park and we walked to the Meat Packing arwa for dinner.

We stay here frequently...great location, well appointed rooms with all the amenities, super friendly, professional, helpful staff ready and willing to provide outstanding service....close to parks, shopping, public transportation, Greenwich Village , Soho and environs. ..simply a really nice place to stay!

The guys that were working the Front Desk this past Sunday were great- they couldn't have done more to make my wife and I feel welcome and special.This is a modern hotel, recently refreshed and large rooms by NYC standards.We'll be back

I just wanted to say that if your looking for a wonderful place to stay in New York City then look no farther than the Hyatt Union Square. I just stayed there a week ago and plan on staying there next week for another five days when I return to the city for business.. Just seems that everyone at the hotel has a fantastic attitude toward all their guest, and I mean all the staff from the doorman to the cleaning staff to the front desk, just went above and beyond to make sure I had a great stay and all my needs and concerns were met..Could not have asked for a better stay from the Hyatt Union Square!!!!!

This hotel management is making feel like if you were redundant.I had a bunch of early appointments in the city and asked the evening before for an in room breakfast at 6.30 in the morning which is the earliest you can get in the heart of NYC !!!? the breakfast never came and I only had a phone call to explain that they had no cereals !I doubt they gonna see me again

The Hyatt Union Square was a comfortable, if small, room. It was quiet and the staff were excellent. The location is perfect for walking just about anywhere. The bed was great and the bathroom lovely design and use of small space.
user_name:
LJS13
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Overall I would say the experience was a good one and that I would consider staying here again. I liked the new rooms, comfortable beds and clealiness. The room, while small, is smartly designed such that it gives a larger appearance. Staff are very nice and the location is perfect. One of the elevators was not working for three days out of our stay which was somewhat annoying as it caused a wait going both up and down. We took a terrace room and while the terrace is cool, relatively spacious and furnished, I would not come back and pay the price I did just to have the terrace. I believe the regular rooms are just as small as the terrace room and cheaper. Overall I think this is a good choice for the city with a few quirks which when fixed can make this a great hotel.

We arrived early, not expecting a room to be ready. We were told they did have a room ready and to my surprise were had been chosen as the platinum upgrade of the day, we were given a late checkout of 2pm for the following day! FD staff was helpful throughout our stay, tips and hailing cabs for us. Our room was really nice, clean, housekeeping came by to see if we needed anything, really exceptional service. The ONLY thing I didn't like and this is has nothing to do with staff or service, was the bathroom door. It is just a shower door, its see through so I was sharing the room with my 21 year old daughter that was fine, but if it was a friend it would have been weird.It was a really great stay! great location!!

This is my new favorite spot in NYC. It's relatively new so the property is in excellent shape!! It is centrally located and well-priced. So close to the subway at Union Square that you can get anywhere pretty quickly for work or pleasure. The staff is extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The cost is reasonable by NY standards. This is a nice size hotel--not too large so it is not overrun with people. The rooms are great! There is a gym, but I haven't used it.

Comfortable and cosy. Modern and Clean with good facilities. Staff very friendly and helpful. The location is superb and Union Square has lots going on and is surrounded by a plethora of great restaurants and shops.

Rooms are small No amenities No turndown. Good gym. Staff very helpful. Should have free coffee in morning as well as newspapers . Excellent location for East Village. Many similar hotels are better but price is reasonable.

I can't say enough about our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. We chose to stay here for my husbands surprise trip for his 40th birthday. The location is perfect. Its right in the middle of everything and close to the subway. There are lots of choices for shopping and dining within steps of the front door. The rooms were beautiful. I say "rooms" because we had one small issue with our first room which was quickly addressed by Jorge at the front desk and we were immediately moved. He was so courteous and accommodating that we really didn't mind the small inconvenience. We booked a room with a private terrace, wow! Too bad it was 100 degrees last weekend- I would've spent more time out there. I also loved how quiet the rooms were, I got such a great nights sleep during our stay. There is no doubt we would stay there again. Highly recommend the Hyatt Union Square!

I stayed in the Hyatt at Union Square because I had business more downtown rather than up around Central Park as usual. I did pop "uptown" on the underground which was extremely easy -- Union Square-Time Square-Lincoln Square. The hotel is a boutique hotel with a great gym, nice lounge/bar and small restaurant. The staff was delightful and helpful. Best of all it was an easy walk everywhere. I think I found my new base in NY.
user_name:
Steven B
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Stayed for a long weekend and throughly enjoyed our stay. Modern and clean with a great location. One block from a major subway. Easy walk to west village for terrific restaurant choices. Easy access to all of Manhattan.

Great locations, great style, great service.... Staff is awesome - very helpful!! Will stay there again when in Manhattan.... Not your traditional Hyatt - much better, very stylish and a bit edgy. Room is very comfortable.

The hotel is wonderful. You are greeted by warm staff who make check-in seamless. The hotel has all the amenities: restaurant, room service, gym, in room coffee and a great mini bar with snacks in the room. The room was quiet in spite of the central location (I didn't hear other guests or traffic) and has blackout curtains with a comfortable bed. The service was incredible (they brought me a toothbrush and toothpaste that I forgot). The location is fantastic in Union Square at a lower price than I expected. I will definitely stay again. Thanks for such a relaxing trip!

Another typical Hyatt - great service, particularly check-in. Comfortable room, nice walk-in shower. Non-impressive dining - then again, it is New York, there are dozens of excellent places to eat nearby. Good location if you need to be near Union Square or the nearly dozen subway lines just a block away. Would consider staying here again

While there is not much to choose from in the way of 4 star hotels near Union Square, I would choose this hotel every time. The staff is friendly, helpful and always smiling. They seem genuinely interested when talking to patrons. I hurt my back before coming there, and needed to ice my back. Front staff personnel brought me ice filled bucket within 5 minutes each morning it was requested. Need a magnified makeup mirror? Not a problem. Delivered to my room while I was out for the day. Rooms are large enough, beds are very comfortable and you can't beat the location if you need to be in the Union Square area.

I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for 10 days and it was a lovely property. The Staff were great and always helpful. I would definitely stay here again.I would rather have a mini fridge for use in the room instead of the mini bar which I never used - it would be nice to have that option.

Great location! Great service! The staff were very attentive and the room was clean and nicely appointed. Hyatt Union Square is within easy walking distance of Union Square and Washington Square Park. I would recommend dining nearby at The Mermaid Oyster Bar in Greenwich.

We enjoyed our short but wonderful stay at this Hyatt. They upgraded us without our request & even offered us an early check in when we arrived a few hours before the posted time. I asked housekeeping if they had a safety pin available & when i returned to our room there were a few sewing kits and a pile of about a dozen safety pins left on the room desk for me. We will definitely return & recommend this Hyatt for a stay in New York City to anyone!

We stayed here the first weekend in August and loved it. George checked us in and sent a special treat upstairs as we were celebrating a birthday - he was so thoughtful! Everyone greets you entering the hotel and wishes you well when you leave -they're to be commended for a great front desk staff. They had a room ready right when we checked in and held our luggage when we checked out as we weren't leaving the city yet, which was great. Shower is SOOO fantastic and spacious and the CO Bigelow products are great. Hairdryer was nicer than most, which is a nice touch. We needed some extra towels and they were up in 5 minutes - the whole staff here is fantastic. Fitness center is HUGE and very well appointed with fruit, water, cool towers, and magazines. The property is very quiet and calming, which is a great respite from the bustle of Union Square. We had a lovely time and would absolutely recommend the property to anyone looking for a home away from home in NYC.

I will say this, the entire staff was Exceptional! Very engaging, helpful and courteous. My daughter and I had a recent stay of 9 days and everything was nothing short of fantastic! It feels as if we have extended our family! I want to give a special thank you to Hannah, you are the Best! To François and the rest of the crew, Thank you for everything! If anyone is in need of a car service for any reason, Use Jesse Transport. They are referred by the hotel and are, By Far, the very best way to get around the city!

Looking for a staycation, this location was selected and was well worth it. Hotel staff was friendly, courteous and professional. The room while not cheap was a terrific value especially for a summer night in NYC. A beautiful shower, comfortable bedding, located in a vibrant area and close to public transportation all made for a great night. I would definitely stay here again.

Light, quite and highly comfortable room with a nice view (no. 403). Friendly, attentive, caring staff. Would expect a much cleaner shower and toilet area for the price though, but cannot complain since I'm not leaving tips :(

I stayed here twice in a month dropping off and picking up my daughter from NYU summer program. This is a great location for East Village and subway access to the rest of the city. The rooms are comfortable, clean and well appointed. The staff is very attentive. I would definitely recommend it.

The Hyatt Union Square is in an excellent location, within walking distance of many great restaurants and shops. The rooms are a good NYC size - not big but certainly in line with what I've experienced before. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Free wifi in the rooms.
user_name:
Reneed586
New York City, New York

review_body: Beautiful accommodation, great Service, perfect! We will come again on our next trip to NY! Thank you very much!The hotel is close to the Subway station Union Square and perfect to get quick to the hot spots of Manhattan! Special thanks to Hannah from the front desk for everything!!!

The Hyatt in Union Square is a modern, clean hotel with big rooms for NYC and a really attentive staff. Seems like it's been recently remodeled and it's nice. My only beef is that you can hear almost every noise in the hallway in your room!! Seems like the walls are pretty thin, so I was hearing everything from the ding of the elevator to the housekeeping staff going through the closet next to my room to (not the hotel's fault) the drunk guy who was locked out and was angry about it! Great location for what I needed and plenty of amenities in the hotel and nearby. I do wish the room service menu had a few more casual options as everything was kind of high-end entrees.

Good for business and vacation purposes, great location- very close to main interest areas (by foot) and to the Union square metro station, nice and helpful staff; good room conditions, service and cleanliness

A great spot literally around the corner from Union Square park. Close to various subway lines and loads of great dining spots. Walking distance to Soho, East and West Village etc. Spotless and quiet rooms with very comfy beds and loved the Bigelow bathroom supplies. The staff were so welcoming, friendly and helpful. A great hotel, we will certainly return.

Front desk cheerfully greeted us upon arrival. Room was very clean. There was a minor issue with the window not closeing, however, engineering immediately arrived and corrected the issue. The room was very clean and the shower is amazing.

Hotel is superbly situated - one block of Union Square which means all the convenience, with little of the crush of humanity the minute one steps out the door. Averse to rooms that face an airshaft, opted for the more expensive street view room. Bed was comfortable and decent amenities, though why oh way can't a little space be left in the mini fridge to store the odd item?? Another hotel trend is bathroom designed more for form than function which in this case meant an oddly huge sink with no counter space that was so far from the mirror that it was nearly non functional. Despite the modest size, rooms offered a good measure of sound privacy and street noise was of the pleasant city "white noise" rather than overwhelmingly loud. Common areas of the hotel were chic and easy to navigate. After a disappointing coffee from the on site restaurant one morning, I found many a better option steps from the hotel. Front door, desk and housekeeping staff were quick to accommodate the slightest request with an easy though professional manner. Lobby and lounge were smartly decorated and comfortable. Too bad the price point is so steep, but it's NYC...

There was hammering on the wall at 130 am that went on for 20 minutes and then yelling The next morning I wa stuck in the elevators and then both elevators were shut down. Finally the fire department arrived to rescue people from the other elevator. Not a good experience!

The location was great because we needed to be in an area where my daughter's friends are living. If not walking distance we were a short uber or subway ride away. Service was great considering that did not apply to many other places in NYC! Staff was friendly and helpful.

Hotel was great. All of the employees were exceptional in their eagerness to help. Very warm and friendly. The restaurant and bar area are warm and inviting. The hotel looks and feels chic.Also the fitness center is a great one.

Everything was fine. Room was clean, front desk was very helpful.Check in and out was easy. Only negative I would say is that valet parking cost of $75.00 seems very high, understanding that its NY.Would recommend for others

Stayed here for one night and was able to easily access great dinner restaurant, roof top bar and braid way play. The check in and check out process was expeditious and pleasant. I would stay here again in the future.

This is a very clean hotel and the staff were polite and provided great suggestions on where to eat and how to travel around the City. Its in the heart of Union Square, close to the square, subway and restaurants.

Small, unpretentious, relaxed, welcoming & very cool. Great location to union square, 5th ave shopping, easy walks to too many interesting & eclectic areas. Staff are friendly & helpful. If you like big, showy, noisy, touristy hotels then don't stay here. Low key with style & class. Have stayed there for the past 3 years & will continue to stay there when I visit NYC

The staff, especially concierge Francios, went above and beyond each time. They enjoy meeting and helping their guests. Hotel decor was NYC cool but earthy. Beds were super comfortable. We'll configured room and bathroom.Quiet (though there is a fire house around the corner but I hear sirens even at home some nights.

Small boutique style hotel with great rooms that are reasonably sized and have comfy beds. Room design and furnishings are attractive. The large walk in shower, large bath and designer toiletries were nice features, too. The on site restaurant serves a good breakfast, and the bar has a great selection of single malts. Outstanding staff.

Very much enjoyed my stay here; the room was always clean and a good size especially being in NY. Wish there had been a mini fridge in the room to keep water cool, but that was very minor. I didn't get to eat in at the hotel restraint or go to the bar because I was always working too late, but I definitely would like to check them out next time. I could see the Empire State Building from my window, which was lovely. Also liked that it was in a great location near Union Square and 5th Ave (a very short walk to my office). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Andrea Polignon... J
Richmond, United States

review_body: This was the first time my children and I stayed at the Hyatt in Union Square. The staff was very nice and very helpful with any questions or needs! The location is great! it's very easy to hop on the subway to ANYWHERE or just walk around. Unfortunately, the walls are very thin. We could hear everything going on next door to us and in the hall way. The morning cleaning was extremely loud only because the walls are so thin. My kids and I were told to keep quiet one evening when we were just talking and watching TV. Granted it was late ( we were getting use to the time difference), so we felt bad, but we should be able to talk without bothering the people the next door at any hour. the thin walls is my only complaint. Otherwise, a very nice hotel!

Excelente location! Great service ! Very helpfull! Very cleanGood breakfast! Very Good hotel a little pricey !I likees the location very much you have Walgreens Union Square the metro Station, all one blocs away!

Very poor service!Not recommended , no breakfast! waiting 40 minutes to get the room ready , the view of the room to a tall ugly building. Our expectation was much higher, no toothache in the restroom , very small room

Right in the heart of busy, noisy Union Square sits this lovely hotel. I stayed in a quiet court side room which was very comfortable. The doorman who is also a musician is one of the nicest, kindest people I have ever met in a short period of time. Would stay there again in a second.

Loved the proximity to Union Square, The Public Theater, Flatiron District , etc.Nice rooms and relatively spacious for NYC. We booked two rooms, but one room was not ready until 4:50 (check in time is supposed to be 3). That was disappointing but the hotel comped the 24 hr parking fee ($65) so I was satisfied.

I have stayed at numerous Hyatt properties. This one had great front desk workers but the room wasn't spectacular. We upgraded our room and it wasn't worth the extra money. The temperature wasn't cool enough even with efforts to lower it. And our bed did not have a sheet on it under the comforter. Overall, wasn't my favorite Hyatt experience

Absolutely loved everything about my stay at the Hotel.Staff are very helpful with anything & everything. Restarant and bar are great. Will be going back again in Sept.Would have not any hesitation in recommending your hotel.

I very much enjoyed my stay. The rooms were very nice. The location was perfect. The people were great. The bed was very comfortable. There is a nice bar downstairs and and a very cute restaurant.I would definitely recommend this hotel!
user_name:
QB1Ventures
New York City, New York

review_body: Hyatt Union Square great location East Village! Room queen size bed very comfortable and quiet for NYC hotel.. Bathroom small, but very adequate... No problem. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable about area. Best part was the restaurant.. The Fourth! Food and service perfect for breakfast, lunch and dinner! Highly recommend this hotel!

Clean comfortable room. Nice restaurant and bar. Great staff!Not to mention a wonderful easily accessible location! We had a quick visit and the concierge and bell staff very helpful.The breakfast buffet was more than adequate. This hotel completed a wonderful vacation!

This understated, yet consistently satisfying and comfortable small hotel near Manhattan's Union Square has been our pick when staying in the City, because of its clean, efficient rooms, reasonable cost, impeccable service, high-quality yet down-to- earth amenities, and super-convenient location.Our small room had lots of natural light, a very comfortable King bed with fresh bedding, clean composition flooring, a compact but elegant bathroom, wifi included, a nice widescreen TV, and an adequate small coffee maker. The staff, from the manager, who personally welcomed us, to the unfailingly helpful desk and door personnel, to the efficient and cheerful cleaning and maintenance crew, were all stellar. When we needed to leave all of our luggage someplace for almost a full day after checking out, it was no problem to check multiple bags into storage and to retrieve them quickly at almost 11PM. There are always cabs and limos waiting at curbside, yet in Manhattan terms, the traffic outside the hotel was never intense.This hotel does not have glitzy, big common areas, but has a very comfortable lobby, a small restaurant ( which we never tried), a nice, quiet, bar just off the lobby suitable for meeting friends or associates, and a very well-appointed basement fitness room that I used every day, rivaling those I have used in European luxury hotels. The location enabled us to spend several days in the City enjoying friends and family, a Broadway show, fine dining, and attractions like the High Line, shopping, and museums without setting foot in the subway. I definitely give high marks to the Hyatt Union Square.

2 comments - while the room had bottles of wine and baskets of junk food, there was no refrigerated minibar. I would have chugged down 3 $12 Cokes, but no beer, liquor, water or soda.Meanwhile at the bar, the service was great, the dinner price was reasonable, but then $95 for two drinks? Really?!I wouldn't stay here again. $500/night should feature a better experience.

I love this hotel - it's 3 blocks from my work and in a great part of town with lots of buzz -- and great eats, drinks, and play spots! The rooms are big and the decor is awesome. The folks that check you in are speedy and make it easy.

This hotel is centrally located with great amenities in the area. Check-in was fast and efficient. The room was clean and sleek. Only complaint is our room was very hot, didn't even sleep with blankets or sheet and we were still very hot. I would stay here again if the temperature is better.

Convenient to walk to restaurants and entertainment,staff was friendly and helpful , I would have given it a 5 but 1 of the 2 elevators was not operational during our stay, there is a small refrigerator in the room but no room for our drinks as it was fully stocked with theirs, next time I would request for it to be unstocked, we had breakfast in the hotel and it was a bit pricey but high quality and delicious.

I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel in July. The room was smaller as is the case in NYC, but it was very comfortable - bed, pillows, duvet, air conditioning, etc. It's a great location near grocery stores, subway, bars, etc.

The staff there was so helpful and kind! They were friendly and respectful! It was obvious that they work hard and do all that they can to help their guests!I stayed right next to the elevator and didn't hear the noise from it.Spotless rooms!!Really made my stay 100% lovely!

For our recent stay here.Only for one night.Last time I stayed was around 14 months ago. Rooms are already showing signs of wear which is unfortunate. See the pics below.Had an issue with the bathroom as well on this stay. Opening up the partition door I was hit with a strong uric acid smell. Not sure if it was a plumbing issue or not proper cleaning of the bathroom. The walk in shower smelled especially bad. So I called won to explain what was going on. Also to add the bathroom had a box of empty tissues when we checked in.The front desk said they would send cleaning and engineering to figure out what the issue was. Upon returning later that night, the bathroom smelled of bleach, which is a good thing, but also disappointing int he fact that this should never have been an issue to begin with. Sad to see that this property is being managed in the way it is. It will only get worse unless housecleaning and upkeep are brought up to speed and made accountable for the quality of the rooms.

The location was super. You will be one block from many subway lines. The staff was friendly and on it! Our room faced a courtyard and was quiet and peaceful. The food was solid and the atmosphere was excellent.

Stylish, quiet, great location, great service, and a good value. I came in late one night without reservations. The front desk attendants were incredibly helpful in finding me a comfortable room. Everything was great.
user_name:
BillTam
Saint Paul, Minnesota, United States

review_body: Hotel is very nice and clean. Staff friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions of places to eat. Door man very nice and helpful with luggage and taxis. There is a nice bar in the lobby. Food was good at the hotel restaurant.

Very convenient location by Union Square and subways. Wonderful attentive staff! Enjoyed some pre dinner cocktails in the bar with wonderful service. Have stayed several times and will do so on future visits.

Stayed here on a Friday night. We arrived early and requested an early check-in, which we received along with an amazing upgrade. The staff are warm, friendly, and efficient. This was a business trip, and I brought my family with me -- perfect for both purposes. Highly recommended!

This hotel is fabulous! My room was a single with a King bed. It was small but I like the layout. The decor was nice and modern, and the products were great. Pillows were amazing. The employees at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. And the location couldn't be beat! Right near Union Square, very accessible.
user_name:
lizjenkins5
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The people, the modern styling, the effortless location. This was such a beautiful getaway in the city. I absolutely can't say enough wonderful things about this stay. It was just divine. A hidden gem!
user_name:
HotelDeeDee
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location! Amazing staff! Stylish room!The only complaints we had are regarding the bathroom comfort; the faucet in the sink, although very stylish, is to low! You can’t fit both of your hands when you want to wash them – unless you slide them, under the faucet, one by one. Very uncomfortable! Another thing that was missing, again – comfort reasons only, was a Hand Held Shower Head in addition to the Wall-Mount Shower Head.

A very good hotel overall. Good location is a big plus. Small rooms are expected on NYC but I we surprised there was no regular Hyatt breakfast: it never happened before in any other Hyatt. Also it is the first time we were not upgraded, and even though I did book hotel for two ladies and asked for separate beds we needed to sleep in one bed and everything (towels, shampoos, a robe, even an evening square of chocolate) were made for one. People at the reception were very friendly.

前台接待很热情，服务很好，房间床铺每天都换，服务人员都很热情。周边环境也好，比较安全，感觉，地铁交通方便。people here are very nice. the sheet. towers are changed every day. the room and the equipments are very clean. the traffic is very convenient and the place is very safe. will stay here again next time.

I stayed 3 nights at the Hyatt Union Square over the 4th of July weekend to visit my daughter. I thoroughly enjoyed both the hotel and location. My room on the top (11th) floor was very comfortable, modern, quiet and well appointed, with floor to ceiling windows and an open feeling. The surrounding area has much to do and see and the nearest subway station is only a block away. The staff was very friendly and professional. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Needed a place to stay at the last minute. I was in NYC and stopped in and they had a few rooms for one night. My last stay downtown in NYC was at the W Hotel which is much pricier but nice. The Hyatt was decorated similarly to the W but not as big and not as much....by a long shot. The room was clean and everything worked without a hitch. The shower head was one of those big, sunflower style jobs that they have in nicer country club locker rooms. Very nice! The shower itself was also very nice; roomy. The bed was very comfortable and even the pillows were fine. Usually I find that hotel pillows are too padded and too stiff for my taste. I like a "low" pillow that is loose that just keeps my head off the bed. The pillows here were very close to that. TV worked easily....nothing confusing to have to figure out.

Extremely disappointed that one of the two elevators did not work the whole time we were there. We were not informed of this ahead of time because we would have changed plans. The elevators were extremely slow and if you used the stairway there was no re-entry.I think this is very poor business practices. I thought this was equivalent of bait and switch and it was not appreciated. They also say they have a roof top for entertaining and it wasn't open. They also give you an amenities list and when we asked for some they never delivered.

Elevator was out of action for half our stay (8 days) which was irritating. Shower and bed was decent. Service was slow in the bar due to being understaffed. It was an okay stay but I'm not sure I would stay again. A shame. It looked promising.

Clean, friendly, hip, centrally located, and I'll be back. I know that sounds simple but that's the truth. Loved the decor, it didn't feel like your normal hotel. It feels like your staying a high end swanky place. 5 stars for me!

This is the first time I've ever done a review while still at the hotel. So I've been here now just 12 hours and I'm blown away already by this place. The rooms are gorgeous and have everything you need and more and super clean. You think perfect right. Well the bit that has blown me away are the staff. They can't do enough for you. From allowing me to look at another room was more appropriate for me ( nothing wrong with other room just prefer the view with this one) to bring me food that's not on the menu served perfectly. Simply perfect. Thank you my new second home in New York. I will be back.

Generally the hotel was great -- good location, clean, quiet, well-maintained, nice (NYC-sized) room. Except -- the door to my room did not latch (close all the way) when you let it close by itself. I learned this when housekeeping left the door to my room unlatched after they finished. Nothing was missing, but I was concerned about the safety of my stuff. The front desk staff were very apologetic and said that they would have maintenance look at the door and make sure housekeeping was more careful. I assumed it was a problem just with my room, but a colleague staying at the hotel told me that the same thing had happened to him. What are the odds that two random rooms (out of 178) both had this problem -- and no other rooms do? My guess is that this not-latching problem is a systemic problem at the hotel. I would not feel safe leaving my belongings in the room during the day. Rating based on quality of the hotel -- not on safety of my stuff.
user_name:
Christopher S
Cambridge, MA, United States

review_body: This is my second one week stay in 2 months. The hotel is nice, rooms are good. But the service is very poor. On several occasions, my room was not cleaned before 4PM, sometimes 6PM. The elevators do not work very well. For 6 continuous days, only one was working for this eleven floor hotel. It's a huge waste of time. I already noticed trouble with the elevators during my first stay. Unless Hyatt corrects these major inconveniences, I will not come again.

Stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for a seven-night holiday with my husband and had a great stay in an Urbane Terrace room. The room was a good size for New York and the terrace was excellent if a little bit noisy as it's so close to the street with plenty of sun in the morning (second floor, 4th avenue side). Decor is nice and modern and the bed was very comfortable. Most importantly, the room was clean and in a good condition. The only thing that was slightly lacking in the room was storage, I prefer a tidy room with suitcases and shoes out of sight but the wardrobe space was very small with only just enough room for the clothes of two people (even though we stayed a week I wouldn't say we had an excessive amount of clothing with us!). The only slightly negative comment I have is that the "business center" is a bit basic - more like a standing-only computer station and I have frankly seen better in Holiday Inn and Four Point hotels which are somewhat cheaper. All staff were really friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay again if I was visiting the same area.

I have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square NY 3 times this year, as it is near a relative's home. I have had a great experience each time. The hotel is in a modern style, with friendly and helpful staff. I stayed in an Alcove Loft, which is roomy (for New York) corner room, light and airy and has great views out of windows on two sides. It has a little sitting area, a desk, 2 TVs and and very comfortable bed. In terms of amenities, the hotel has a very nice gym, beautiful roof deck (which they don't promote--I'm not sure why because it is great on a summer evening), a nice bar and good restaurant next door. The one bad experience I had was getting stuck in the elevator but someone answered the call button right away and I was out of there in about 10 minutes. Last but not least, the last time I was there I forgot some clothes and they located them and shipped them right to me. Kudos to the honesty and responsiveness of the housekeeping staff! (As an aside, I've never recovered anything I have left at a hotel in the past). I will definitely stay there again when visiting family in the area.

The service of everyone from the doorman to the front desk to the bartender was fantastic. The only name I remember was Tracy at the front desk, who was super helpful. I wish I would have written down the names of the other people who helped us so I could write them here, but everyone was great. Everyone seemed to do what they could to help us out. And, given the location, this is my go-to hotel when I'm in the city.

This hotel was actually booked by someone else at an excellent price. I was blown away at how nice the hotel was and how friendly the staff were. Nothing we asked for seemed to be a problem at all and in fact the staff seemed very happy to help us out. Will 100% be coming back here again!

Rooms were nice, but an ice machine would have been nice. Didn't want to keep bugging for someone to bring ice up to our room. Staff was friendly all the time we n passed. Nice location. Bed was confortable.

The room was comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Requested information on Catholic churches for next day never received. Enjoyed the sites of New Nork, Handy location able to walk to all the places visiting.

Location terrific. Many NYC attractions within walking distance. Taxis always readily available if needed. The rooms were very comfortable and refreshed very nicely on a daily basis. Dogs barking throughout the night very annoying. Staff very helpful with directions, suggestions for sightseeing and for restaurant choices

Great property. The rooms are clean, useful, modern, and artsy. The staff will do whatever it takes to make your stay enjoyable! The entire hotel is quiet, the room service staff perfect, and the location in lower Manhattan is ideal.

This Hyatt location is convenient to the Union Square area and Astor Place business district. It's also within walking distance to some great restaurants (such as Ribalta). The staff is very friendly, accommodating and helpful. The rooms are updated and have a warm, inviting feeling -- which is refreshing after walking the streets of NYC! I prefer this hotel when in town on business.
user_name:
Christine P
Kennesaw, Georgia, United States

review_body: I usually stay in cramped, awful hotels in NYC and pay ridiculous parking fees at local garages (*I am in sales and I have to drive in, no trains for me). The Hyatt had great staff, a wonderful restaurant and bar, normal sized modern rooms with goodies that actually cost reasonable prices and valet parking. I probably paid $50 more than I usually do if you factor in the garage parking and it was beyond worth it. I was there for a seminar at NYU and I could walk or Uber for a couple bucks. A friend saved lots of money by booking a cheap hotel to save money near times square. It took him and hour and a half to get to the seminar and he missed the first half...

There are Countless Reasons to Stay At this Hotel!  I checked into the hotel on Saturday July 2nd for One Night.I was in town to visit my favorite Vegan Restaurants, see 3 shows and go on a Street Art Walking Tour.As soon as I arrived I was greeted by a super friendly doorman & Dan at the front Desk checked me in.Dan is by far the friendliest Hotel employee I have ever encountered. He truly exudes the true meaning of hospitality.I feel blessed that I was able to interact with him during my Check In, Check out & Bag Storage processes.This Hotel is gorgeous & the rooms are gorgeous! It is very clear that a great deal of thought went into the room design and bathroom design.I loved that the shower included an inlaid shelf for shampoo etc and there was a small shelf to put your leg on if you needed to shave your legs.I know this is probably a trivial thing to matter but that small leg shelf makes a world a difference. Thank you.The Bed was so very comfortable & the citrus water in the lobby is a beautiful touch. ~ I was also able to check in early which was fantastic as I was able to freshen up a bit before heading out.Dan told me all about the Hotels restaurants & gym during Check In which was awesome & even asked if I had a preference as to which floor.I chose a room on the third floor & it included a beautiful view of the courtyard.The location is perfect which is why I chose it initially. With this Hotel you are in the middle of the best downtown NYC/Union Square area has to offer.I am looking forward to returning as soon as my schedule permits.I would like to add 1 suggestion: There is an awesome Coffee maker & Starbucks Verona coffee in the room but they are hidden away inside the Mini Bar, perhaps add their location to the Housekeeping card on top of the Mini Bar. I am so thrilled that this Hotel exists in my favorite area of NYC!

Great Location for this end of NYC. Great room for the price and everyone at the hotel was very accommodating. The restaurant was good for breakfast and the service was very good.This is not our first stay and we will go back again.
user_name:
Jeffrey W
Cherry Hill, New Jersey

review_body: The location is great, 100m to the sub way station, 100m to the union square park where during the Summer they have daily market and on weekends more farmers open their stalls. Whatever I need is close bu.Great location if one is in NY to visit NYU.For the hotel, I would rate it as average. The reception area is casual (a bit disorganized). The room is small and looking out to nowhere (room 1018). The interior of the room could have been better to make use of the small area.They need to up grade the cleaning service, I had found that they had not serviced my room by 5pm and they did not change the bed sheet.I will still come back since the location is hard to beat.

I've stayed here many times and basically stopped for a couple of reasons. For this trip it was very convenient but I wouldn't have stayed here otherwise. Some of the rooms are rundown and my repeat business isn't valued or recognized in any way at all. Not even, welcome back! I have never been upgraded here which is rare as I travel a lot. There are other better places to stay in downtown NYC. Also, I am tax exempt and every time I check in they do not know how to handle tax exemption. The cheapest rooms are usually the most rundown. I've had rooms where the sink was cracked, there was a giant bleach stain on the bathroom wall (gross!) and the bedroom floor was sticky (also gross!). The people at the front desk are very friendly but this is really a management issue.
user_name:
Tracy A
New York City, New York

review_body: I regularly stay at the Hyatt union Square for work. The rooms are small but the location is great, the rooms are quiet, and the gym is spacious and well equipped. My only suggestion is to ask for a room away from the service elevator which can be loud.

Very clean but small King room. Modernized, and close to everything. Nice shower with pressure. Beds are firm and not as comfortable as I would have liked. Friendly Staff with easy check in/out. In room coffee was great and didn't require a trip to starbucks. Rooms are close in proximity and accessible to elevator; however, very loud at night.

I recently stayed four night at the Hyatt Union Square. I found the customer service from the entire staff very friendly and professional. The guest room I had was relatively large for NYC, well appointed, and sparkling clean. The hotel is in a great location, 1 block from a major subway station, and finally the price for my stay was very fair! I absolutely recommend this hotel,

The room was a bit small but everything was good. Bed was very comfortable.When we had trouble with the coffee machine it was fixed immediately.The location was very convenient for our planned activities

The hotel was very nice, the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel lobby and bar are really nice. Very convenient to Midtown and Soho. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in the NYC area.

The hotel has a boutique feel. From the front desk to the doorman everyone remembers your name and is always willing to help. The location is wonderful location close to NYU, tons of restaurants and an easy bike ride or Uber to the west side.

This was my first trip to New York. It was for a conference. I loved the hardwood floors and room setup in the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Walking distance to some vegetarian and gluten-free friendly restaurants, huge bookstore on the same block, and 7th&14th subway stop close by. I would definitely stay here next time. We appreciated the advice about how long it takes to JFK- we would have been late if we had relied on the time set up by the travel agent.

Staff, room, look and feel were all above and beyond our expectations. Design was a large factor in this hotel's look and feel, staff is totally friendly, knowledgeable and professional. We's staff again if the need arose and would certainly recommend it to others

A nice and conveniently located hotel. I stayed four nights in June. The room was clean and comfortable with all the necessary amenities. Good size for New York standard. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

From lobby to guest room, fitness center to restaurant, this property is gorgeously designed, thoughtfully prepared, and perfectly staffed. Room 1111 is one of the most elegantly appointed rooms I've seen in any urban setting.

Great location....extremely convenient, easy to get to...yet still quiet and not overly busy. This is not the big huge mid town NYC type hotel....when you check in, you will not face a line with 40 people on it. The staff are all super nice and they remember who you are. They gave a $10 room credit per night for the mini bar...I recommend you use it on the drinks and not the candy as the candy was completely stale, and I made the wrong choice.The only reason this got 4 stars was because someone in the next room was smoking all night....I called to complain, and a very strange man who called himself the "fire marshall" came to my room, knocked on the door, and was very dismissive...he said "just turn on your air condition, and you will not smell it any more". When I explained to him that I already had the air on and could still smell the smoke, he gave me a look and just walked away. A it off putting.
user_name:
Frank A
Branchburg, New Jersey, United States

review_body: I stay here frequently when in New York for leisure travel. The property is lovely, well appointed, well managed and the location is unbeatable for walking, subway, cab. Great restaurants, bars, shopping, parks within a stone's throw.

I love this property because they paid attention to the details in my reservation and my reservation requests. If they could they accommodated. My younger sisters spent their first real stay in New York. They had a blast at the hotel. You guys made them feel so special as if they were celebrities. I can't thank you enough! Lucia......Thank you!
user_name:
QueenBraham
New York City, New York

review_body: A decent hotel. Rooms are small (no surprise) but clean and efficient. The location is great, right around the corner from The Strand Bookstore... Union Square. Two restaurants on site. Not a ton of frills and you'll pay for everything. My biggest complaint is that "complimentary coffee" is only offered from 5 until 7 am - come on... obvious intention is to push people into the restaurant. I encountered some very nice employees, others were borderline rude. You may notice a rooftop terrace in some of the photos, but, such does not exist - at least not for use by all customers (if it exists it is dedicated to a particular room), we even asked about it and were told that they don't have any such thing. Overall, not remarkable, just fine.

My husband and I really enjoyed staying here for my 30th birthday trip to NYC. The room was really designed to pack a great punch in a small space. Also, there were a few people on the hall that I was worried would be loud but our room was noiseless! However, the staff were really amazing - thanks to you all! Your recommendations, greetings, and accommodation were top notch!

We had to travel to NY for my sister-in-law's wedding that was being held near the Hyatt Union Square Hotel. We selected this hotel because it was in a great location, cost seemed reasonable, and because of the listed amenities. We requested an early check in since our flight was coming in at 6AM. By the time we landed, we received an email to check in online and a prompt email back saying our room was ready. When we reached the hotel, our room was indeed ready and it was a welcome relief since we were exhausted from flying on the red eye flight across the country.
